snippet: The federal Medicare agency had not clearly defined “conflict of interest” and did not enforce standards to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions, according to a new report.
abstract: Report from Health and Human Services inspector general Daniel R Levinson says Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services has not clearly defined 'conflict of interest' among doctors and pharmacists and does not enforce standards meant to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions.
lead_paragraph: The federal Medicare agency had not clearly defined “conflict of interest” and did not enforce standards to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions, according to a new report.

headline.seo: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions
headline.main: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions
headline.print_headline: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
